{"step_by_step_thinking": "Potts puffy tumor is a rare complication of frontal sinusitis. It is characterized by a subperiosteal abscess with associated osteomyelitis of the frontal bone. The infection can spread to the underlying dura mater, causing epidural abscess and potentially leading to intracranial complications. Given this information, the most appropriate answer choice is B. An extradural abscess.", "answer_choice": "B"}
